projects.title: Eneco Energie
projects.description:
Eneco, the trading name of Eneco Holding N.V., is one of the largest producers and suppliers of natural gas, electricity and heat in the Netherlands, serving more than 2 million business and residential customers. Eneco headquarters are located in Rotterdam. It also carries out energy trading and is involved in sustainable energy projects.

Eneco is the largest power company in Zuid Holland.

The company is divided into five business units:[1]-

Eneco New Energy - responsible for sustainable generation and sustainable energy projects
Eneco Energy Trade - responsible for trade in energy and biomass
Eneco Netherlands - the main company, supplying gas and electricity to the Netherlands
Eneco Installation Companies - responsible for heating installations and the supply of energy to customers
Eneco International - responsible for projects outside of the Netherlands

As a part of the Eneco Central Integration team I was participating as a TIBCO designer and developer. We are responsible to integrate different systems within Eneco as well as third party enterprises. Also, I was involved in delivery and deployment automation for TIBCO business works code. 
I majorly work with TIBCO Business Works 5.11, TIBCO Business Works 6.X, Oracle, Java, Gradle, Jenkins.

projects.title: ZIGGO (Ziggo Integration Center)
projects.description:
Ziggo is the largest cable operator in the Netherlands, providing cable television (digital and analog), broadband Internet, and telephone service to both residential and commercial customers.
 
They deploy ZIC (Ziggo Integration Center) Team, in order to create a combined and consistent view of their core information as well as process assets and leverage them across the enterprise to drive business decisions and operations. This project focused on integration competency center (ICC), which is a shared service function within an organization, particularly large corporate enterprises uses for performing methodical data integration, system integration. 

As a part of this team we are integrating different systems to enable efficient information exchanges and business process automation across different applications in a cohesive fashion using web services and SOA standards.

projects.title: Vodafone
projects.description:
The NTS is the system that currently handles the CRM, trouble ticketing and billing for the SDSL(Symmetric Digital Subscriber Line) product. Vodafone Egypt (VFE) has launched a plan to replace the NTS and move its functionalities to be done through Siebel, TIBCO and BSCS in order to align to the VFE landscape and have more control and flexibility over the functionalities.

As a Designer/Developer from TMNS, we are helping VFE to implement the use cases supported by NTS to be done through TIBCO Fulfillment Orchestration Suite (FOS). 

The project is evolving around TIBCO Fulfillment Orchestration Suite (FOS). Different components are communicating With FOM (Fulfillment Order Management) via XML/SOAP over JMS.

projects.title: BCHydro SMI
projects.description:
BC Hydro is one of the largest energy providers in BC province of Canada. The aim of the engagement is to provide business solution to the client so as to strategically enable them align with their long term objective of increased customer satisfaction by enabling customers to actively manage their energy choices, adopt new energy and conservation solutions, and benefit from an electric grid that is modern, reliable, safe and cost-effective. Which in turns improve customer service, achieve conservation and energy efficiency, achieve operational efficiency, protect revenue.
The project solution is implemented on SOA platform with TIBCO BW as the core integration technology and TIBCO BE as complex event processing tool. The entire project scope has been spread across multiple releases which assist meeting target objectives in a planned manner and in a cost effective manner.

projects.title: Citi COPS (Centralize Offer Palette System)
projects.description:
This is a Citi Banks Project. COPS is responsible for the creation of the different types of offers for different types of customers depends on their level transactions, festive seasons, and also by tracking the life style. COPS is also responsible for triggering events to inform the customer via e-mails, SMS, service call etc. it sence the response by the customer on an offer and take the appropriate action on it. 
COPS maintain the appointment related information which are schedule for agents and help the Offer Manager/Owner, to track the offer promosion and different statistics.

projects.title: Nielsen BuzzMatrix
projects.description:
Nielsen is a leading global information and measurement company that enables companies to understand consumers and consumer behavior. Nielsen measures and monitors what consumers watch (programming, advertising) and what consumers buy (categories, brands, products) on a global and local basis. The company has a presence in approximately 100 countries spread across Africa, Asia, Australia, Europe, Middle East, North America, South America and Russia.

As a part of TIBCO PSG group we are responsible to support production environment for middleware (Tibco BusinessWorks) and BPM (Tibco iProcess) oriented issues.

projects.title: TIBCO Tibbr
projects.description:
TIBCO tibbr, announced in January 2011, is a social media system for the workplace. It manages input and output feeds to outside programs and integrates with other social media platforms. Sixty companies, or 50,000 users, have signed up.  
As a part of the TIBCO Engineering team I was responsible for the creation of TIBCO BusinessWorks Palette for tibbr 3.0 which communicate with tibbr server for posting and retrieving messages.

projects.title: WorkFlowManagementTool(WFMT)for British Telecom
projects.description: WFMT is a web base BPM(Business Process Management) tool used to plan and monitor the work flow. British Telecom Planner use this tool to plan jobs which include requirement capture, addition of components, catagorisation and Authorization of job, assest Registration, assigngment of contractor & monitoring the progress.

profile_positions.description:
Nederlandse Spoorwegen (NS) is a Dutch railway company, a semi-public company with an nvstatus, the shares of which are held by the Dutch State.

NS uses the Dutch rail network, which is managed by ProRail. The Dutch rail network is the busiest track in the European Union[1] and the busiest rail network in the world after Switzerland and Japan. [2][3] More than half a million people traveled daily by train[4] in 2007 and 10% of passenger kilometers were carried out by train in 2017. [5] The length of the railway network, compared to the number of inhabitants, makes it one of the densest networks in the world. NS is the largest user of this network to date.
